import { Controller, {{ className }} } from '@/application/controllers' import { ServerError, UnauthorizedError } from '@/application/errors' describe('{{ className }}', () => { let sut: {{ className }} let sutAdressUseCase: jest.Mock const sutAdressCreatedAt = new Date() const sutAdressMock = { createdAt: sutAdressCreatedAt, district: '', number: 0, userId: 1, city: 'city', state: 'state', street: 'street', zipcode: 'zipcode', country: 'country', complement: 'complement' } beforeEach(() => { sutAdressUseCase = jest.fn().mockResolvedValue(sutAdressMock) sut = new {{ className }}(sutAdressUseCase) }) it('should extend Controller', async () => { expect(sut).toBeInstanceOf({{ className }}) }) it('should build Validators correctly on save', async () => { const validators = sut.buildValidators({ tenantId }) expect(validators).toEqual([ new Required(tenantId, 'tenantId') ]) }) it('should return 500 if fails new {{ className }}', async () => { sutSubscriptionShow = jest.fn() sutSubscriptionShow.mockRejectedValueOnce(new Error()) sut = new {{ className }}(sutSubscriptionShow) const httpResponse = await sut.handle({ tenantId }) expect(httpResponse).toEqual({ statusCode: 500, data: new ServerError() }) }) });
